<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Hello, how can i help you today?
Seeker: Hello there, i am having a hard time because my boyfriend and I just broke up
Helper: I'm so sorry to hear that. Was there any reasons that lead to the decision?
Seeker: I think I was feeling overwhelmed by his political views and with the election and everything it became much more obvious that we weren't right for each other. But Im nervous with the holidays coming up that I will be sad to be alone
Helper: I feel you, it's scary to not be with the person you love so suddenly, especially during holiday
Seeker: It is!! we were together for 5 years, so this is uncharted territory for me
Helper: However, from what you told me, it's no longer fit for you two to be together as your views are opposite. Maybe this is for the better. You can plan to spend the holiday with your friends or family instead. We are usually busy and neglect the most important people. This is the time to take care of that

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Empathy"], "feedback": "The goal is to empathize with the seeker's feelings of being alone during the holidays and to provide reassurance. It would be good to provide comfort and reassurance rather than jumping into giving advice. The helper could have spent more time validating the seeker's feelings before offering solutions.", "badareas": ["Suggestions", "Validation"], "alternative": "It must be hard thinking about facing the holidays alone after being with someone for so long. It's okay to feel sad and overwhelmed with the changes, it's part of healing."}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: I understand how difficult it can be to take what might be a life changing move. I have been in that position myself. I can't tell you what to do but I can say that it worked out very well for me.
Seeker: I don't like feeling lots of anxiety, so I feel like I want to keep doing what I'm doing. But then I don't want to miss out on this new opportunity.
Helper: Have you contemplated seeing your doctor? They might be able to help with your anxiety.
Seeker: I haven't thought about seeing a doctor. It could help. But I also feel like nothing can help me.
Helper: I know things can feel hopeless when you're in a bad mental place but please don't lose hope. Things will definitely improve but I think you should take steps to help yourself too

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Empathy"], "feedback": "The goal is to validate the seeker's feelings and offer comfort. While the helper provides empathy, it could be more effective to focus on the seeker's feelings and explore them further.", "badareas": ["Suggestions", "Structure"], "alternative": "It sounds like you're feeling really stuck and hopeless with this anxiety that's been with you for so long. That's a really heavy burden to carry. Is there anything that you've tried in the past to help with your anxiety?"}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Hello there! How are you doing?
Seeker: Hello. Not so well. I have a very stressful job situation right now.
Helper: Oh no, I am very sorry to hear about that. Can you tell me more about your situation?
Seeker: I really never got along with my coworkers. I think they purposefully harrass me sometimes. For example, yesterday during lunch time, they took my soda and threw it on the garbage can, then said "oops, I thought it was empty".
Helper: I'm so sorry to hear that. It sounds like you are being bullied at work. Is that right?

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Empathy"], "feedback": "The goal is to validate the seeker's feelings, not draw conclusions. Here the helper labeled the situation as 'bullying' which may not be how the seeker sees it. It would be better to mirror the seeker's language, reflect their feelings, and ask more open-ended questions to explore the situation further.", "badareas": ["Reflections", "Questions"], "alternative": "It sounds like you're feeling targeted and disrespected by your coworkers. Can you share more about how these situations make you feel?"}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: That's great. You've already taken a huge step by reaching out for help and that's a big deal! A good next step might be letting the people around you know that you need some support at this time. Sometimes people don't know something until you tell them, even if it seems obvious. Is that something you can do?
Seeker: But i can't tell this to them because they also become sad when they know about this
Helper: Okay, I understand. Do you feel embarrassed because this is happening to you?
Seeker: yes i am. and i don't know how to overcome from this kind of sadness
Helper: I understand that your feelings of sadness run very deep. Do you have people in your life who you can safely spend time with without necessarily talking about your feelings? Feeling connected to people can help quite a lot.
Seeker: yes i have someone. who is my well wisher
Helper: It's great that you have someone who can give you positivity and support. Do you feel comfortable with trying that or would you like to explore other options?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions", "Empathy"]}</s>

Helper: I had a college degree but found out my career wasn't working out financially. Online college became a lifesaver because I could have the flexibility of being at home. You don't have to be exposed to COVID when doing online work or college options.
Seeker: Yes, that's true. Maybe that will help me pass the time too when it is so hard to be at home. I would be working toward a long term goal.

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: So you're a female and you're married to a female? There's nothing wrong with that at all!
Seeker: Yes....well we are not living together now. We have to file papers for divorce
Helper: I see. So you're actually legally married - didn't just have a commitment ceremony?
Seeker: Yes legally married
Helper: Care to share what led up to filing for divorce?
Seeker: She cheated. And as far as I know is still with the person
Helper: I can certainly understand how that feels. I have been in your EXACT situation.
Seeker: It's horrible and hard to move on for sure
Helper: How long were you with her?
Seeker: Don't laugh. Our one year wedding anniversary was this past Sat. Which I know I shouldnt be so miserable but I am. I think because like some people have told me we were still in our honeymoon stage. We were not fighting or having big issues....she just cheated
Helper: I'm so incredibly sorry to hear that. You realize this behavior, these choices, are a flaw within her, and not you?
Seeker: It's hard to see that. I feel like a failure and not good enough. Like why even get married in the first place if you are just going to cheat
Helper: It's completely normal to feel like that, especially when trust is broken in such a way. It's important to remember that it's not a reflection of your worth.

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Self-disclosure", "Validation", "Empathy"]}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: Can you please share what is on your mind?
Seeker: Hello. I am dissapointed in the teachers that I always get. They seem to make my courses so much harder. I think I just get incredibly unlucky at times.
Helper: I see. You feel unlucky and disappointed that the teachers cause your courses to be challenging?
Seeker: Exactly. I compare myself to my friends and, for example, they get barely any homework. It almost seems unfair.
Helper: Course work is already stressful enough but to be challenging in addition only adds to the pressure.
Seeker: Yeah. But I swear, every single one of my teachers just seems so imcompetent at times.
Helper: I remember an English teacher of mine, always calling me out in class, saying that she expects better of me when my papers weren't the best. Her class was hard and I worked hard to complete my assignments as instructed. Instead of her speaking with me personally, she'd embarrass me. I did not like her class at all.
Seeker: Those are the worst teachers. I wish teachers like those would get fired. I just want to have a chill time like most teenagers
Helper: Is there enough time to maybe select more compatible teachers or speak with the school counselor about classes that work best for you?
Seeker: That's the thing. I never get to pick my classes. And they always give me crap recommendations. I Think I need to drop by the office
Helper: That is a great idea. I'd encourage you to speak with your school counselor to share your needs and maybe the 2 of you can come up with a plan to create a schedule with teachers that can help you be successful.
Seeker: I am absolutely certain that I am capable of succeeding at school without over stressing. Hopefuly this will fix the issue.
Helper: I believe you are correct! Less stress certainly creates a better learning environment. School counselors are your ally. Remember, you can go to them anytime you need them. Are you stopping by this week?

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": ["Validation", "Questions"], "feedback": "The goal is to affirm the seeker's self-efficacy and encourage them to take action. It might have been more effective to emphasize the importance of sharing their concerns with the counselor, rather than asserting the counselor's role as an ally.", "badareas": ["Suggestions"], "alternative": "I can see that you have a clear understanding of what you need to succeed in school. It's great that you're considering talking to your counselor about this. What are some things you'd like to discuss with them?"}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Seeker: caught my girlfriend cheating on me
Helper: Oh wow! I'm so sorry! I can't imagine how you are feeling! Have you found anything to do to keep you busy? Or maybe some good distractions?
Seeker: no! all i think of is her, loved her wish she never did that
Helper: Do you think you guys could reconcile your relationship? Is there any hope? Is she willing to work with you and work through her mistakes?
Seeker: i wished we could, i just cannot get it of my mind
Helper: It takes time. Sometimes, the best relationships occur when people work through the most difficult occurrences in their relationship. Have you tried talking to her? I would recommend talking to her when your emotions have settled.
Seeker: guessed you right, i just don't know if i can trust her, I don't think i can heal from the betrayer
Helper: I would make a pros and cons list. If there are a lot of pros, I think it's worth a shot! Just give yourself time to process everything that has happened. You don't want to sit down and talk to her and let all your emotions come out. That could cause more harm. Just make a list and you'll have a better understanding of which direction you should go with your relationship!
Seeker: i understand, its just hard to trust when the trust is broken, hard to know what direction to turn to, forgive her or move on, to choose is just a hard decision. Guess i need to hear her own part of the story
Helper: Yes. Give it time. Wait to hear her story. Make your pros and cons list. And see where to go from there. Be easy on yourself. It's okay to have hard days. Just give yourself time to heal from the hurt!
Seeker: I try working towards that, i just wish am back to myself soon because it has really affected me.
Helper: It sounds like you're really feeling the impact of everything right now. Are there any friends or family members you feel comfortable talking to about this?

### Response:{"perfect": true, "goodareas": ["Questions", "Empathy"]}</s>

<s>Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.

### Input:
Helper: That sounds like a good plan! It also helps to make sure that it’s dark and very quiet. Surprisingly enough, when they did research on sleep disorders they found that a lot of people just needed quiet and darkness.
Seeker: Have you tried lavender? I have heard pillow or room sprays can be good for sleep.
Helper: Yep, I’ve tried a LOT of things. I’m currently struggling with this myself. I’m even trying out melatonin, tryptophan, and even CBD (not stoney weed oil)! So far no success, but I’m still trying!
Seeker: I've heard people mention melatonin - I might use that later if other methods dont work. It's good to know other people are in the same boat.
Helper: It’s one of the reasons that it’s good to get outside. Your body makes melatonin from sunshine, so going for a walk outside helps in 2 ways!
Seeker: If we had a little more sunshine where I live that would be fantastic!
Helper: Getting good sleep is critical. Supplementing with melatonin might help compensate for your lack of sunshine!

### Response:{"perfect": false, "goodareas": [], "feedback": "The goal is to help the seeker understand the potential benefits and limitations of using melatonin as a sleep aid. It would be beneficial to provide more information about the possible side effects and to encourage the seeker to do their own research or consult with a healthcare professional.", "badareas": ["Suggestions"], "alternative": "Sleep is indeed crucial for our well-being. Supplementing with melatonin might help, especially where there's a lack of sunshine. However, it's always a good idea to  consult with a healthcare professional before starting a new supplement. It could have different effects on different people."}</s>

Helper: While I do not have kids, from what I have seen my friends and family do in this situation is try to find something that your daughter is interested in and attempt to build off of that. Seeker: That is great advice. She does climb and hasn't been able to climb or see her friends with everything closed. You are right she is becoming an adult and will find her place. At 17 I guess she doesn't have to decide just yet. You have certainly made me feel a bit more positive.
Helper: Sorry for the delay. I am glad you are feeling more positive. I was into cars so I went to vocational school to become an auto mechanic. After a couple years of that I realized I wasn't cut out for physical labor and went to college.
